intro: Machaerina melleri, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like appearance with narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Machaerina melleri is adapted to grow in a variety of soil types and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade. It has been used traditionally by Māori for its strong, fibrous leaves, which were used to make clothing and other crafts.
